meeting_annotations.transcript: Uh so um frequently we think of emergent properties as properties that of a community or a consortia that can only mean be measured when that consortia is acting together. meeting_annotations.speaker: Heather Bean
meeting_annotations.transcript: So quorum sensing is um a regulatory mechanism that um microbes use is best studied in bacteria, um to uh only turn on the production of community goods, so goods that cells will share with each other, they will only turn on the production and the regulation of these community goods once there's enough a large enough community there, um in order to benefit from those goods. And so each individual cell will produce a molecule that is put out into the environment and every cell can sense the amount of that molecule in the environment. So every cell is making the signal and then when the signal gets concentrated enough, the cells sense that there's a lot of partners around and that will turn on the production of community goods.
meeting_annotations.screenshare_content: None
